alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 4:08PM MDT until July 04 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Southwestern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 408 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles east of Teton Reservoir to 8 miles northwest of Grand Encampment to Hog Park Reservoir, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Albany, Saratoga, Encampment, Elk Mountain, Grand Encampment, Battle Lake, Six Mile Campground, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Haskins Creek Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Lost Creek Campground, Little Sandstone Creek Campground, Bottle Creek Campground, Battle Creek Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Arlington, Hog Park Reservoir and French Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 247 and 275. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
